intro: Jacobaea tibetica, commonly known as Tibetan groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cold and arid conditions. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Jacobaea tibetica is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
